title: How to use this course
pageBody: We want you to have control of your learning. We're giving you complete freedom over what you view and when you view it, so you can have things just the way you like them.
body: Some quick tips to help you get the most out of your course and give it your personal touch.

title: Hear from our Vice Chancellor
pageBody: The Monash Doctoral Program provides you with a variety of innovative training opportunities that help you build a dynamic combination of skills. No matter where you see yourself going, these skills will complement your thesis and improve the range of opportunities available to you.
body: Hear how the Monash Doctoral Program supports the development of your professional skills.

title: Take a look inside
pageBody: Explore twelve short topics to learn all about project management, why it's important to you, key project management principles and practices and what's involved in creating your project management profile.

title: Your career starts now!
pageBody: Want to discover what you can do? Your career isn't something that happens later – you're in it now, even while you're in your PhD. The decisions you make now impact what you can do next and what's possible after that. Don't wait until the final months of your final year to start thinking about your life after your PhD. Think about it now!
body: Find out why planning for your career is important now.

title: Communication and your career
pageBody: In the book, Communicate or Die, Thomas Zweifel talks about the value of good communication to success as a leader. In research, this plays out as the mantra "publish or perish". Essentially, it's the importance of communicating the findings of your PhD research. For career success, you should plan your PhD publications with your career in mind – not just your research (career) in mind. Written communication will be key to realising your future opportunities, inside or outside research. So, "publish or perish"; "communicate or die".
body: Discover how publishing impacts your career.

title: Beyond your phd
pageBody: What does your post PhD career look like? Are you looking to stay in academia? Is a non-academic career for you? The opportunities are endless – but do you know what you want to do? What do the statistics suggest? Is academia a likely career? Let's find out.
body: Time to think about what life looks like after your PhD.

title: The portfolio career
pageBody: What's a portfolio career? It's a shift from the traditional full-time job. It involves working multiple part-time jobs with multiple employers.  What does this mean for you as a graduate researcher? How will you prepare to deal with the portfolio career? Let's find out.
body: Are all career paths the same? Find out here.

title: Network and connect
pageBody: Most, if not all of us, are aware that success – wherever it might happen – is a product of the people you have around you. It's clear our networks count. Networking is all about growing the number of people who know you, know your work and would be willing to chat with you about it. So, how can you create an effective network and connect with people who will help you onto greatness? Let's find out.
body: Grow your network. Learn how and why here.

title: The mentor factor
pageBody: Can a mentor positively impact your career – indeed your life in general? The answer is yes. The right mentor can be critical in helping you to understand your strengths and weaknesses, and then leverage your strengths and address your weaknesses. However, few of us act on this knowledge in a formal sense. If pressed on the question "do you have a mentor" many of us would stumble for a few seconds before saying "kind of". It's as if verbal confirmation of such a relationship might make it all disappear. Or worse still, the response is the truth and we only kind of have a mentor.
body: Do you have a mentor? Find out why they can make all the difference.

title: Set your goals
pageBody: Setting goals for your career is no different to setting goals for other parts of your work or personal life. Why set goals? Goals help you establish what it is you want and need from your career. They enable you to direct and measure your efforts and plot a clear path to achievement. Successful career management includes careful consideration of short and long term career goals. Let's learn more.
body: Learn how to set career goals here.

title: Do the work
pageBody: What are employers looking for? They're increasingly looking for people who exhibit certain behaviours and willing to train skills, rather than looking for skills and training behaviours. What does this mean for you? Be the employee you want to be, not the student you are. Perform the role you want to have, not the role you have.
body: Find out what can you do now to be a step ahead.

title: Build your plan
pageBody: Great – you've decided that a career plan is for you. Now, how to build one. In this section, we outline three different approaches that can set you on the right course. So, what are you waiting for – it's time to identify the steps and factors that will bring your career to life.
body: Learn three different ways of career planning.

title: Take the opportunities
pageBody: Your career plan will set out the various skills and experiences you need – but how do you develop them? What are the options? Particularly given your current focus should be completing your PhD.
body: Build you skills and expertise during your PhD.

title: It's just a plan
pageBody: You've spent a great amount of time thinking about your goals and putting a plan together. It's important to realise all you've done is created a plan. The plan is not a substitute for work and it certainly can't get you skills, experience or a job. The plan, is just the beginning. It's an indication that you're on the wrong side of a lot of hard work – in the best possible way of course.
body: Learn tips to make the plan work for you.

title: Take action
pageBody: It's time to put an action plan in place and set yourself up for success! How? Reflect on your career development training, knowledge and experience and plan for your future career development.
body: What are the keys to successful implementation?
